The process begins with a request for sample products from the supplier. Following this, the supplier provides sample products. Once the samples are received, it is checked whether the samples meet the requirements.

If the samples meet the requirements, the appropriate product is selected, and a purchase order is sent. If the samples do not meet the requirements, the product specifications are adjusted and the process returns to the supplier providing new samples.

Upon sending the purchase order, the supplier checks the stock availability of the product. If the stock is available, the product is sent. If the stock is not available, inventory replenishment is initiated. Once restocking is complete, the stock availability is checked again. If the stock is available after restocking, the product is sent.

When the product is received, it is checked to ensure that the order and the physical product match. If they do not match, missing products are requested and further verified upon their arrival. If the order and physical product match, payment authorization is sent, followed by the processing of the payment. Upon completion of payment processing, the supplier is notified, concluding the process.

tasks.name: Check order and physical product match

1.text:
The process begins with a request for sample products. Once the request is made, the product is selected, and then a purchase order is sent.

Upon sending the purchase order, the availability of stock is checked. If the stock is not available, the inventory is restocked. If the stock is available, it is verified whether the stock meets the product specifications.

If the stock meets the specifications, the product is sent out, and then it is received. After receiving the product, it is checked against the order.

If the products do not match the order, the missing products are requested, and the process returns to restocking the inventory. If the products match the order, a payment authorization is sent, and then the payment is processed. Finally, the supplier is notified that the payment has been made, and the process concludes with the supplier being notified.

Throughout the process, if at any point the sample does not meet the requirements, adjustments are made to the product specifications, and the process loops back to selection of the product and sending the purchase order again.

This process continues until all conditions are satisfied, ensuring the sample meets the requirement and the ordered products match the physical products received.

2.text:
The process begins when sample products are requested by the warehouse supervisor. The supervisor selects the product and sends a purchase order. The supplier checks the stock availability.

If the stock is available, the supplier sends the product, and the warehouse supervisor receives the product. The next step is to check if the order and the physical product match. If they match, the supervisor sends a payment authorization, processes the payment, and notifies the supplier. The process then concludes with the supplier being notified.

If the stock is not available, the supplier initiates a subprocess to restock the inventory. Once the inventory is restocked, the supplier checks if the stock is available and repeats the process.

If the order and physical product do not match, the warehouse supervisor requests the missing products. The supervisor will retry the check until they match, at which point the process follows the previously mentioned steps: sending payment authorization, processing the payment, and notifying the supplier.

If the sample products do not meet the requirements after restocking, the supplier adjusts the product specifications, and the process repeats to select the product and initiate a new purchase order.

The supplier provides sample products and checks if the sample meets the requirements. If the sample meets the requirements, the warehouse supervisor selects the product and the process continues. If the sample does not meet the requirements, the process is directed back to adjusting product specifications by the supplier.

Finally, it returns to selecting the product and continues the cycle until the requirements are met, ensuring the correct product is selected and delivered. This process ends when the supplier is notified after processing the payment.

The process begins when an application is received by the recruitment department at ADOmoney Bank. First, the application documents are reviewed and pre-selected. 

If the application is not suitable, a rejection message is created and sent to the applicant, and the process ends with the applicant being rejected after preselection.

If the application is suitable, it is checked whether the application is for a key position.

If the application is for a key position, a telephone interview is conducted. Based on the telephone interview, it's decided whether to proceed with scheduling a personal interview.

If the application is not for a key position or if the interview shows potential, a personal interview is scheduled and communicated to the applicant via email.

Following the personal interview, the appointment and applicant documents are forwarded to the relevant department. This leads to another decision point to evaluate the application further.

Next, the application documents are examined in detail. Another evaluation determines whether to conduct an assessment center.

If an assessment center is warranted, it is planned and prepared. An appointment is then scheduled with the applicant for the assessment center.

Once the assessment center is conducted, there is a voting process on the applicants. Whether the applicant is accepted or rejected depends on this assessment.

If the applicant is not successful after the assessment center, a rejection message is drafted, sent to the applicant, and the process ends with the rejection.

If the applicant is accepted, an acceptance message is written and sent to the applicant, marking the end of the successful application process.

Forward appointment and documents to relevant department

1.text:
The process begins when an application has been received by the recruitment department of ADOmoney Bank.

First, the application documents are reviewed and pre-selected.

After the pre-selection, an exclusive gateway determines if the applicant is applying for a key position. 

If the applicant is not applying for a key position, an appointment for a personal interview is communicated to the applicant via email. 

If the applicant is applying for a key position, a telephone interview is conducted.

After the telephone interview, regardless of outcome, either gateway leads to a task where an appointment for a personal interview is communicated to the applicant via email.

Subsequently, the personal interview is conducted. 

Following the interview, an exclusive gateway checks certain criteria.

From here, if specific conditions are met, the appointment and applicant documents are forwarded to the appropriate department. 

The department then conducts the assessment center.

Following this, the department plans and prepares for the assessment center and schedules an appointment with the applicant.

At this point, a parallel gateway ensures both scheduling the assessment center and conducting it happens in conjunction. 

Upon conducting the assessment center, a voting process on the applicants takes place. 

Another exclusive gateway determines further steps based on the assessment outcome.

If the applicant is rejected after the pre-selection, a rejection is drafted and sent to the applicant, ending with the application being rejected after preselection.

If the applicant is rejected after the assessment center, a similar process of drafting a rejection and sending it to the applicant occurs, ending with the application being rejected after the assessment center.

If the assessment center favorably votes for acceptance, an acceptance letter is written and sent to the applicant, and the process concludes with the applicant being accepted.

The process begins at ADOMoney Bank when an application has been received. The application documents are first reviewed and pre-selected. If an applicant is pre-selected, the next step is to decide whether the application is for a key position.

If the application is for a key position, a telephone interview is conducted. Depending on the outcome, a subsequent detailed examination of the application documents is performed. If the candidate is further considered suitable, a personal interview is scheduled. The department is informed about the personal interview appointment and the applicant documents are forwarded. After conducting the personal interview, the decision is made whether to accept or reject the applicant. If the applicant is accepted, they are notified with an acceptance letter. If not, a rejection letter is drafted and sent.

If the application is not for a key position or if the applicant passes the telephone interview, an assessment center is planned and prepared. An appointment with the applicant for the assessment center is scheduled. The entire assessment center is then conducted, after which a vote on the applicants takes place to determine the final decision. If the applicant passes the assessment center, they are accepted and notified. If the applicant fails at any assessment stage, a rejection letter is sent to notify them of their unsuccessful application.

Throughout the process, if an applicant is rejected at any point due to pre-selection or poor assessment results, the respective end events are triggered with appropriate rejection notifications being sent.

The process starts at SoKnow with the event of claiming revenue. 

Initially, it needs to be determined whether to ensure self-financing or to receive funding. If the decision is made to ensure self-financing, steps are taken to ensure this. Alternatively, if the decision is to receive funding, the necessary funding amounts are received.

Subsequently, a downstream check is made to confirm if the self-financing or funding has been ensured. Once this check passes, efforts are directed towards gaining a high market share in open-source solutions and generating revenue through additional services. 

Next, both tasks culminate in parallel tasks which involve organizing training units and performing consulting services. These organized training units lead to performing consulting services which subsequently generate follow-up projects.

Finally, with these follow-up projects, the process concludes with the revenue being successfully claimed.

tasks.name: Gain high market share in open-source solutions

1.text:
The process starts with the claiming of revenue at SoKnow.

The next decision is whether to ensure self-financing or to receive funding amounts. Either option can be pursued.

If funding amounts are received, the process moves to ensuring self-financing.

Following that, there is an evaluation that checks if both ensuring self-financing and receiving funding amounts have taken place before moving forward.

Next, a parallel path begins where efforts to gain a high market share in open-source solutions and generate revenue through additional services are pursued concurrently.

Upon the completion of either of these tasks, the process continues with further parallel actions including organizing training units and performing consulting services.

Once the training units are organized, consulting services are performed.

Finally, generating follow-up projects is the last step before the process concludes with the revenue being claimed.

tasks.name: Gain High Market Share in Open-Source Solutions

If it is decided to ensure self-financing, that action is carried out.

Afterward, the process continues to ensure high market share in open-source solutions and to generate revenue through additional services in parallel.

Following these parallel tasks, the process advances to either organize training units or perform consulting services.

Once organizing training units or performing consulting services is completed, the next step is to generate follow-up projects.

Finally, the process ends with the revenue being claimed.

The process begins with a student entering the library. The student then proceeds to a PC to search for books. If too much time elapses while the student is at the PC, they will continue searching for books. Once the student has finished searching for books, they proceed to the checkout counter.

At the checkout counter, the library staff checks the student's ID. If the ID is not valid, the student receives no books and leaves the library. If the ID is valid, the student receives the books and leaves the library.

1.text:
The process starts when a student enters the library. The student goes to a PC to search for books.

If the time elapses while searching, the process continues without any change. 

Once the student has searched for the books, they proceed to the checkout counter.

At the checkout counter, the librarian checks the student's ID.

If the ID is valid, the student receives the books and leaves the library.

If the ID is not valid, the student does not receive any books and still leaves the library.

The process ends when the student leaves the library.

2.text:
The process begins when a student enters the library. 

The student first goes to a PC to search for books. 

Depending on whether the student spends too much time searching, time may elapse; if so, the student continues searching.

After finding the books, the student goes to the checkout counter. 

There, the library staff checks the student’s ID. 

If the ID is valid, the student receives the books, and after receiving the books, the student leaves the library.

If the student’s ID is not valid, the student receives no books and then leaves the library.

The process begins when a customer places an order for food. This triggers the chef to send the order to the sous chef in the kitchen. The sous chef is responsible for managing the order of cooking. Once the order is managed and the food is cooked, the cooking task is carried out. After cooking, the chef sends the meal to the sous chef for a final check.

The sous chef checks the food and, if it meets the standards, calls the waiter to grab the food. The waiter then sends the food to the customer, who proceeds to enjoy it. Upon completion of the meal, the process ends.

tasks.name: Send meal to sous chef for final check

The waiter then takes the food and sends it to the customer. The next step is the customer receiving the food and starting to enjoy it. Finally, the process ends when the customer finishes enjoying the meal.

The process starts at ACME AG with the recognition that parts are required. If the parts are in stock, they are retrieved from storage and the process concludes with the parts retrieved from storage. If they are not in stock, the requirements are specified and quantified. Once the requirements are specified, a purchase order is completed.

The process then moves to central purchasing where the purchase order is checked. A decision is made to determine if a known vendor exists. If the vendor is known, an order template is created from the purchase order. If the vendor is not known, a new vendor is created.

Following the creation of the order template, the purchase order is sent to an approver. After the purchase order is approved, the receipt of goods is managed which includes the possibility of encountering delivery problems. The status of the order is adjusted accordingly, and the process either concludes with the parts procured or it is cancelled due to delivery problems.

tasks.name: Create order template from purchase order

1.text:
The process begins when parts are required in the department at ACME AG. The first step is to determine if the parts are in stock. If the parts are in stock, they are retrieved from storage, and the process concludes with the parts being retrieved from storage. If the parts are not in stock, the requirements are specified and quantified.

Following this, the department completes a purchase order which is then checked by Central Purchasing. If the vendor is known, an order template is created from the purchase order. If the vendor is not known, a new vendor is created. After the order template is created, the purchase order is approved by the approver.

Once the purchase order is approved, the receipt of goods takes place by Central Purchasing. If there are no delivery problems, the process ends with the parts being procured. However, if there are delivery problems, an intermediate escalation event triggers an adjustment of the order status, and if the issues cannot be resolved, the process ends with the order being canceled due to delivery problems. In every case, the necessary steps are taken to ensure proper handling of the order, depending on the status and availability of the required parts.

The process starts with an undergraduate student initiating an application for IMIS.

The student first goes to the fh-swf website, then defines their search criteria.

Next, the student selects Informatics and Digitalization as the subject area and also selects the Campus Soest.

Afterwards, the student clicks on 'Find a Study Course' and then clicks on 'Learn more' on the IMIS banner.

The student selects the option for a Master Study Course and clicks on 'See how to apply here.'

Depending on their applicant status, the process diverges here at the 'EU Applicant?' decision point.

If the student is a non-EU or international applicant, they proceed to click on non-EU/International Applicant and then apply via Uni-Assist. They need to check the application procedure and then send the required documents to Uni-Assist.

If the student is an EU applicant, they proceed to click on EU Applicant and then apply via the FH-SWF Online Portal. They need to send the required documents accordingly.

In the case where the student is already an FH-SWF Student/Graduate, they can contact the IMIS office directly, and then apply via the FH-SWF Online Portal.

Following the submission, after a waiting period of 4-6 weeks (or 10-12 weeks depending on certain conditions), a decision-making process occurs.

Finally, the process concludes with the receipt of an admission or rejection letter.

Throughout the process, there are parallel steps and exclusive gateways that determine the specific path based on the applicant’s status and needs.

tasks.name: Click on 'Learn more' on IMIS banner
Click on 'See how to apply here'

1.text:
The process begins when an undergraduate student decides to apply for the IMIS program.

The student first goes to the FH-SWF website and defines the search criteria.

They then select Informatics and Digitalization as the subject area and specify Campus Soest.

Next, they click on 'Find a Study Course' and then click 'Learn more' on the IMIS banner.

If the student selects 'Master Study Course', they are shown an information page where they can click on 'See how to apply here.'

From this page, the student identifies whether they are an EU applicant or a Non-EU/International applicant.

For Non-EU/International applicants, they apply via Uni-Assist and must check the application procedure, sending the required documents to Uni-Assist.

Once done, they await a decision within 10-12 weeks.

For EU applicants, they apply via the FH-SWF Online Portal and need to send required documents as instructed on the site.

Once applications are submitted, EU applicants will also check the application procedure and await a decision, but within 4-6 weeks for Non-EU applicants.

For FH-SWF students or graduates applying again, they contact the IMIS office before applying via the FH-SWF Online Portal and sending their required documents.

After the specified waiting period of 4-6 weeks or 10-12 weeks depending on the applicant type, students will get their admission/rejection letter, marking the conclusion of the process.

tasks.name: Apply via FH-SWF Online Portal (FH-SWF students/graduates)

2.text:
The process begins with an undergraduate student applying for the IMIS program. The student first navigates to the fh-swf website and defines the search criteria. Then, the student selects Informatics and Digitalization as the subject area and chooses Campus Soest. Afterwards, the student clicks on "Find a Study Course."

Next, the student clicks "Learn more" on the IMIS banner and selects the Master Study Course. The student then clicks on "See how to apply here," and an exclusive decision point determines if the applicant is an EU citizen or not.

If the student is a non-EU/international applicant, the student applies through Uni-Assist, checks the application procedure, and sends the required documents to Uni-Assist. Following this, there is a waiting period for a decision within 10-12 weeks. After this waiting period, the application proceeds to another exclusive decision point, which determines the final application outcome as either receiving an admission or rejection letter.

If the applicant is an EU citizen, the student proceeds to apply via the FH-SWF online portal and subsequently sends the required documents. At this point, the student waits for a decision within 4-6 weeks. After waiting, the applicant moves to another decision point that finalizes with either receipt of an admission/rejection letter or any next steps if necessary.

During the process, if the applicant is already an FH-SWF student or graduate, they need to contact the IMIS Office for further guidance, and subsequently, resume the application process by applying through the FH-SWF online portal or taking other necessary actions.

The process concludes upon the receipt of either an admission or rejection letter based on the decision-making steps within the application procedure.

tasks.name: Click on 'See how to apply here'

The process begins with the analysis of technology needs within the SoKnow organization. After this initial analysis, a parallel gateway triggers two simultaneous tasks. One task is to conduct a market analysis by an employee, and the other task is for a developer to find ideas.

Following the market analysis, the process reaches another parallel gateway which enables two further tasks to commence. The first task is passing the idea to project management, and the other is continuing from the developer's task to a review of the ideas found.

The tasks from this parallel gateway culminate in an exclusive decision point where the idea is either approved or not. If the idea is not approved, the task to not approve the idea is executed, leading to the next step in the sequence. Regardless of this pathway, the process continues to the same exclusive gateway.

If the idea is approved, the task of approval is executed, leading to another exclusive decision point. Following this, the process concludes with the end event of new technologies discovered.

This workflow ensures that both market analysis and idea generation are completed and reviewed before any decision on approval, ensuring thorough evaluation and leveraging parallel execution for efficiency.

1.text:
The process begins with analyzing technology needs at SoKnow by an employee. Following this, the flow diverges into two parallel paths. In the first path, the developer finds ideas. Concurrently, the employee conducts a market analysis.

Once the market analysis is completed, the process continues to another set of parallel paths. The first path involves passing the idea to project management, while the second path involves reviewing the passed idea.

Subsequently, the project management decides whether to approve the idea or not. If the idea is approved, it is processed further and eventually leads to the discovery of new technologies, thus concluding the process. If the idea is not approved, the idea is discarded, and the review is marked as not approved. The process still concludes after the idea is not approved.

The flexibility of the process allows handling both approved and non-approved ideas to their logical conclusions.

The review of ideas leads to another decision point: whether to approve the idea or not. If the idea is not approved, the employee marks the idea as not approved.

If the idea is approved, the process continues to an exclusive decision point pertaining to final approval details. Regardless of the decision from the approval, workflow proceeds to update decisions and either outcome will ultimately lead to the discovery of new technologies, thereby concluding the process.

First, the application is received by a loan provider.

Subsequently, the document is controlled.

At this point, if the document is found to be complete, it is accepted, leading to the completion of the providing process.

If the document is incomplete, it is returned to the applicant who must then complete the missing information.

Once the applicant completes the missing information, the document is resubmitted and subsequently admitted by the loan provider.

This sequence ensures that the process concludes with the finish of providing documentation.

The process begins with recording the requirement for office supplies. Next, offers are obtained and reviewed. If the offer exceeds 2000 €, the offer must be approved. In case the offer does not exceed 2000 €, it is directly not approved. Once an offer is approved, it is reviewed again to finalize the approval.

If the offer is not approved, the process transitions, where ordering goods takes place. After the goods are ordered, it is checked whether the delivery was completed on time. If the delivery was on time, the final acceptance of goods occurs. If the delivery was not on time, a new delivery deadline is set.

Upon receiving the delivery, an inspection of the delivery is conducted to ensure it is correct. If the delivery is correct, the payment is initiated. If the delivery is incorrect, the suppliers are contacted, and a new delivery is requested from the suppliers. 

The process concludes with either the office supplies being purchased or not based on the approval and inspection results. Throughout the process, communications happen between departments, such as goods being sent to the goods receipt department upon final acceptance and the accounting department to initiate payment.

1.text:
The process begins when a requirement for office supplies is recorded.

The next step is to obtain offers from suppliers.

The received offers are then reviewed, and the process checks if the offer exceeds 2000 euros.

If the offer exceeds 2000 euros, it is either approved or not approved. 

If the offer is approved, it proceeds to the ordering of goods.

If the offer does not exceed 2000 euros, the offer is directly forwarded to the ordering of goods.

Once the goods are ordered, the process checks if the delivery is on time.

If the delivery is on time, the final acceptance of goods takes place, followed by an inspection of the delivery.

The inspection checks if the delivery is correct. If the delivery is correct, the payment is initiated, and the office supplies are purchased.

If the delivery is not correct, the suppliers are contacted, and a new delivery is requested.

If the delivery is not on time, a new delivery deadline is set, and this new deadline is further analyzed to determine whether it matches the expected timeline.

The goods receipt process is managed as a separate entity where the goods enter the warehousing stage.

Lastly, upon final acceptance and payment initiation, the accounting department completes the financial transaction.

The process ensures thorough checks and actions are in place to streamline the procurement and delivery of the required office supplies.

tasks.name: Check if delivery is on time

2.text:
The process begins when the need for office supplies is recorded. The first step is to obtain offers from different suppliers. These offers are then reviewed. If an offer exceeds 2000€, it is approved. If the offer does not meet the approval criteria, it is not approved, but both options lead to the next step. Regardless of the approval decision after the review, the goods are ordered.

Once the goods are ordered, the process checks if the delivery arrived on time. If the delivery is on time, a final acceptance of the goods is performed, and the goods are then moved to the goods receipt area. If the delivery is not on time, a new delivery deadline is set, which may trigger further actions later in the process.

Upon the final receipt of the goods, the inspection of the delivery is conducted. If the delivery is correct, the process proceeds with initiating the payment, and it finally ends with the office supplies being successfully purchased. If the delivery is incorrect, suppliers are contacted to request a new delivery, and this raises the question about the timing of the new delivery. Again, the process checks if the delivery arrived on time, and if not, a new delivery deadline is set, repeating the earlier step.

Message flows indicate that when the final acceptance of goods is performed, the goods are sent to the goods receipt department. Another message flow shows that once payment is initiated, information is sent to the accounting/controlling department.

Thus, the process involves multiple steps and checks to ensure that the office supplies are secured timely and correctly and that all respective departments are informed when their input is required.

The report is then forwarded, leading to the task of reading the report by management. Once the report is read, there is an evaluation step to check if the report is in order. If the report is in order immediately, it is forwarded to the subsequent task without delay.

Once the report is in order, the task of formulating the consulting service is carried out. The process concludes with the completion of the task indicating that the consulting service has been formulated.

The process begins when the task to formulate a consulting service is initiated within the SoKnow pool.

First, the results from a workshop are analyzed, and the analysis is followed by developing new strategic opportunities based on those results.

Next, a report is formulated detailing both the results and the objectives identified.

This formulated report is then forwarded to management to be read and reviewed.

Management checks whether the report is in order.

If the report is in order, it is immediately forwarded.

If any corrections are needed, management corrects the report and then it is forwarded to the next task.

Regardless of the condition of the report, it reaches the task to develop a new consulting service. Here, the formulated consulting service involves drawing up and finalizing the plan of action.

Finally, the process concludes with the consulting service being fully formulated and all necessary steps having been executed.

Management then reads the report. If the report is not in order, it is sent back for corrections. Once corrected, it is forwarded again. If the report is in order, it is immediately forwarded to consulting.

The process begins with SoKnow management recognizing the need for a new marketing campaign. 

Management then plans the focal points of the campaign.

Next, the marketing department designs ideas based on these focal points.

The department proceeds to define specifications for the campaign.

After defining the specifications, the marketing department sends an order to the external marketing agency to create drafts.

Once the drafts are received from the external marketing agency, the marketing department evaluates these drafts.

The evaluation results are put to a vote.

If the vote is positive, the management is informed, and the process proceeds to evaluate the agency drafts.

If the vote is negative, the marketing department requests new drafts from the external marketing agency.

Management will evaluate these new drafts again, either giving a positive evaluation, which results in giving the green light to the marketing department or a negative evaluation, which leads back to requesting new drafts.

When the positive evaluation is achieved, the marketing department is given the green light to conduct the campaign.

Finally, the marketing campaign is conducted and concludes with the campaign ending.

tasks.name: Plan focal points of the campaign
Design ideas based on focal points
Send order to external marketing agency
Evaluate drafts from external marketing agency
Request new drafts from external marketing agency

1.text:
The process starts when a new marketing campaign is upcoming. The management starts by planning the focal points for the campaign. Once the focal points are planned, the marketing department begins designing ideas. After the designs are created, specifications are defined for the campaign.

Following this, the management sends an order to the external marketing agency. The agency then sends the drafts back to the marketing department. Upon receiving the drafts, the drafts are evaluated by the marketing department. If a positive evaluation is given, the marketing department informs the management, which then evaluates the drafts again.

Management then decides whether to give a positive evaluation or not. If the evaluation is positive, the management gives the green light to the marketing department to proceed with the campaign. The marketing department then starts conducting the campaign, and the process ends when the marketing campaign is concluded.

If there is a negative evaluation after the drafts are received from the agency, the marketing department requests new drafts from the agency, which are again assessed. If the new drafts still don't meet expectations, this cycle continues until a satisfactory version is produced. 

During the voting phase, the marketing department votes on the drafts. If the vote is positive, they inform management and proceed as described earlier. If the vote is negative, new drafts are requested from the agency. This process continues until the drafts are positively evaluated, and the campaign is conducted.

tasks.name: Send order to external marketing agency

2.text:
The process begins with the management at SoKnow identifying that a new marketing campaign is upcoming. Following this, the management plans the focal points for the campaign.

Once the focal points are planned, the next step is for the marketing department to design ideas.

These ideas are then used to define the specifications for the campaign. After defining the specifications, a message is sent to an external marketing agency to request drafts.

Once the drafts are received from the agency, the marketing department evaluates them.

If the evaluation is positive, the drafts are voted on by the marketing department. If the vote is positive, management is informed. Management then evaluates the drafts again. If their evaluation is positive, they give the green light to the marketing department, which then proceeds to conduct the campaign.

If the vote on the drafts or the evaluation by the management is not positive at any stage, the management or marketing department requests new drafts from the agency.

Once the campaign is conducted, the process concludes with the marketing campaign ending.

tasks.name: Request drafts from external marketing agency

The process begins with personnel administration managing personnel accounting. The payroll program is then started. Subsequently, automated debits are controlled.

Next, the process splits into multiple parallel tasks. Firstly, bonuses are entered, labor costs are calculated, and salaries, social contributions, health insurance, and additional costs are paid. The task of calculating labor costs recombines with the main process upon completion.

Once bonuses are entered, financial accounting is controlled and the process progresses to sending invoices. After sending the invoices, the main process path joins back with the parallel tasks.

Finally, the process checks and completes payments of health insurance and additional costs, and personnel accounting is completed, concluding the entire procedure.

1.text:
The process initiates with personnel accounting management. The first step in the process is to start the payroll program. 

Next, the automated debits are controlled, and then the process splits into parallel paths. The first path involves entering bonuses, after which financial accounting is controlled. Following this, an invoice is sent, which leads to the process ending with personnel accounting being completed. 

Simultaneously, the labor costs are calculated, leading to another split into parallel paths. One path handles the payment of salaries and social contributions, while the other takes care of paying health insurance and additional costs.

In parallel to these tasks, once these are completed, it ends again with the process concluding with personnel accounting being completed. 

All the paths eventually converge, resulting in the completion of personnel accounting, effectively finalizing the process.

tasks.name: Pay health insurance and additional costs

2.text:
The process begins with the management of personnel accounting at SoKnow. The first task is to start the payroll program. Following this, automated debits are controlled.

Immediately after controlling automated debits, the process branches into a parallel execution of two paths. One path leads to the calculation of labor costs and the other to the control of financial accounting.

The calculation of labor costs proceeds directly into a synchronized operation with other parallelly running activities.

In parallel, entering bonuses takes place, which then leads to the control of financial accounting. Once the financial accounting is controlled, an invoice is sent.

Synchronization occurs at a parallel gateway following the calculation of labor costs and control of financial accounting paths. This synchronization allows for two paths to begin: paying health insurance and additional costs, and paying salaries and social contributions. The payment of health insurance and additional costs is a new path initiated from the previous synchronization.

Finally, after both paying salaries and social contributions, paying health insurance and additional costs, the process reaches a parallel gateway, after which personnel accounting is marked as completed. The process concludes with personnel accounting completed.

tasks.name: Pay health insurance and additional costs

The process begins with the order intake of purchasing a Knowledge Management System by the SoKnow development department.

Adjustments are then requested by the customer company, which triggers the catching of these adjustment requests. 

Subsequently, adjustments are made based on the received requests, which are followed by sending a notification about the completed adjustments back to the customer company.

Next, the department searches for a suitable test group to conduct the tests.

Once the test group is identified, tests are conducted, leading to the categorization of test results.

If the test results are positive, workshops for the test group are conducted. Afterward, employees are trained.

If the test results are negative, further adjustments are made, and this cycle of making adjustments and testing continues until positive results are achieved.

The satisfactory adjustments are then implemented, confirming the adjustments’ success with another message sent to the customer company.

The process continues with training employees once the adjustments are deemed satisfactory.

After the implementation and training, the final product ready message is sent to the customer company.

Following the product's completion, it is implemented, and the process concludes with the order being completed.

1.text:
The process begins with the order intake at SoKnow. 

The next step is purchasing the Knowledge Management System by the development department. 

After this, the system's adjustments are requested by the customer company. 

Upon receiving these adjustment requests, the development department makes the necessary adjustments and notifies the customer company that the adjustments have been made.

Following this, the search for a test group commences. 

Once the test group is found, the test results are evaluated.

If the test results are positive, test group workshops are conducted and subsequently, employees receive training. 

If the test results are negative, further adjustments are made, and another round of testing occurs. 

The results of this second round are again evaluated.

If the adjustments are found to be satisfactory, the Knowledge Management System is implemented, product finished notification is sent to the customer company, and finally, the order is completed.

If the subsequent adjustments are still found unsatisfactory, the process requires further adjustments to be made until satisfactory results are achieved.

If, throughout the process, final adjustments are deemed unsatisfactory, further adjustments are conducted until the final approval of satisfactory results is obtained.

If the final results are satisfactory, the system's implementation continues, product finished notification goes to the customer, and the process concludes with the order completed.

2.text:
The process begins with the start event "Order intake." The Development Department's first task is to purchase a Knowledge Management System. Once the system is purchased, the Development Department awaits adjustment requests from the Customer Company. 

Upon receiving the adjustment requests, the Development Department makes the required changes. After making the adjustments, a notification is sent back to the Customer Company about the adjustments. Following this, the Development Department searches for suitable test groups to ensure the system meets the requirements.

Once the test group is found, the tests are conducted. If the test results are positive, the Development Department conducts workshops for the test group. Subsequently, employees are trained on the new system.

Afterwards, adjustments are received again and implemented as needed until it is verified that they are satisfactory. If the adjustments are satisfactory, the product is implemented and a notification is sent that the product is finished and the order is completed.

If, after the tests, there are negative results, additional adjustments are again required. Testing resumes once the adjustments are made. Should the adjustments still not meet the satisfactory standard, the process returns to further adjustments and subsequent tests.

Upon receiving a positive outcome or satisfactory adjustments at any stage, the final step is the full implementation of the Knowledge Management System, and the process ends with the order completed.

The process begins with the planned discharge in the Department under the Doctor's lane.

First, the dismissal date is set.

This is followed by discussing the further course with the patient and relatives.

After this, there are parallel tasks to be conducted which include defining the supply facility and determining both the nursing care needs and medical care needs.

Following these parallel activities, the process moves to checking if social service is required.

If social service is required, then further care services are to be initiated.

The process continues with creating the dismissal documentation, after which the process flows to the advanced tasks for discharge.

This is followed by the final step of dismissal.

If social service is not required, the process moves to creating the dismissal documentation and then advances to the advanced tasks for discharge before concluding with dismissal.

In parallel to creating the dismissal documentation, the doctor's letter is created.

Finally, the process ends with dismissal.

The process commences when the existing corporate designs are identified as outdated by the marketing department at SoKnow. The marketing department initiates a brainstorming session. Following the brainstorming session, the process moves to the design phase where a new element is designed by the designer.

Once the new element is designed, an exclusive gateway checks the design. If the design is approved, templates are created based on the new design. These templates are then reviewed. If the templates are satisfactory, a communication with management is conducted. 

Another exclusive gateway verifies the templates' quality. If the templates are deemed satisfactory again, the process concludes with the use of new corporate designs. However, if the templates are not satisfactory at any review point, the process loops back to the previous steps. If the designs are unsatisfactory after the second review, the process returns to checking the design after redesigning, mediated by the exclusive gateway.

In summary, the process encompasses brainstorming, designing new elements, creating templates, and reviewing them until satisfactory results are obtained, followed by management approval, leading to the final use of new corporate designs. If at any point, a template is found unsatisfactory, the process cycles back to correct and review.

1.text:
The process begins when the existing corporate designs are found to be outdated. 

The first step is to conduct brainstorming within the marketing department. 

Following the brainstorming session, the task of designing a new element is undertaken by the designers. 

After the new element is designed, the designs are reviewed. 

If the templates of these designs are satisfactory, templates are created based on them. 

Once the templates are created, they are reviewed again. 

If the templates from this review are also found to be satisfactory, the marketing department conducts communication with management. 

If after communicating with management, the templates are found to be satisfactory, the process ends with the use of the new corporate designs.  

However, if at any point during the reviews the templates are found to be unsatisfactory, a new design is initiated, and the design review process starts again. 

If the designs are continuously found to be unsatisfactory in multiple iterations, the necessary steps and iterations of review and redesign are repeated until satisfactory templates are produced and approved for use by the management.

If the initial design review finds the design unsatisfactory, the process goes back to the initial review of the templates. If the management review deems them unsatisfactory, the process involves further refining the designs or templates based on feedback and reviewing them again until satisfactory templates are achieved and approved.

The process begins when Frank's lunch break starts at Global Car Manufacturing Inc. Frank first chooses his preferred lunch. Depending on the choice - pizza or noodles - different paths are followed.

If Frank chooses noodles, he then prepares the noodles and boils water. The two tasks are done in parallel. After preparing the sauce in parallel, the boiling water task is completed, and then the noodles are added to the boiled water. They are cooked for 8 minutes. Once ready, the noodles and sauce are mixed together, after which Frank can eat his meal. Finally, his lunch break ends.

If Frank chooses pizza, he proceeds to choose the order form. He can either access a website to order online, call the pizza delivery person to order by phone, or choose between these options via an exclusive gateway. If he opts for ordering online, he accesses the website and then either completes the process with an intermediate message event to place the order or decides on the phone option. If Frank calls the pizza delivery person, he then waits for the pizza to arrive. The pizza delivery triggers the start of the process at the Pizzeria, where the pizza is prepared. It is then delivered by the delivery person. The pizza delivery person hands over the pizza to Frank, and Frank receives the pizza. He then pays for the pizza, and the pizza delivery person accepts the payment. Finally, after eating his pizza, Frank's lunch break ends.

1.text:
The process kicks off when Frank's lunch break begins. Frank first chooses his preferred lunch. The choice branches off into two potential pathways: ordering pizza or making noodles.

If Frank chooses pizza, he proceeds to select whether to order online or by phone. If he opts to order online, he accesses a website; otherwise, he calls the pizza delivery person. In both cases, he places the order, triggering a wait for the pizza. Meanwhile, at the pizzeria, the process begins with the receipt of the incoming order. The pizza is then prepared, cooked for ten minutes, and delivered. Upon delivery, the pizza is handed over, and payment is accepted from Frank. Finally, Frank receives his pizza and pays for it, completing the order process.

Alternatively, if Frank chooses noodles, he moves on to boiling water and preparing the sauce simultaneously. Once the water is boiled, noodles are added and cooked for eight minutes. After the cook time, Frank checks the noodles and then mixes the noodles with the previously prepared sauce. Following the mixing, Frank proceeds to eat his meal, concluding the lunch process.

Eventually, Frank’s lunch break ends, marking the end of the overall process.

If he chose pizza, after selecting the order form, an exclusive decision is made whether to order online or by phone. If he orders online, Frank accesses the website. If he orders by phone, he calls the pizza delivery person.

For noodles, once the sauce is ready and the water is boiled, Frank adds the noodles to the boiled water and waits for 8 minutes for the noodles to cook. After the noodles are cooked, they are mixed with the sauce. After mixing the noodles and sauce, he eats the meal, ending the lunch process.

In the case of ordering pizza, if Frank places the order online, the order is processed, and a message is sent to the pizza delivery person indicating an incoming order. After the pizza is prepared in the pizzeria, it is cooked for 10 minutes. The pizza person then proceeds to deliver the pizza.

When the pizza delivery person delivers the pizza, they hand over the pizza to Frank. Frank receives the pizza and then pays for it. Once the pizza person accepts the payment, they send back a message confirming the transaction, and Frank proceeds to eat the meal, concluding the lunch break.

The lunch break ends, signifying the conclusion of the overall process.

The process begins when a sales enquiry is created by a customer for Accentis. Once the enquiry is received, there is a decision point that checks whether the customer is inbound or outbound. If the customer is outbound, an enquiry is created, and then a contact is created. If the customer is inbound, a contact is created directly.

Following this, another decision is made to qualify the customer's interest and the price. If the client approves, customer approval is captured, confirming customer interest and satisfaction with the price. If the client does not approve, the enquiry status is updated, and the process ends with a notification that the client did not approve.

If the client's price is approved, the next step involves a requirements analysis. Once the requirements have been analyzed, the next step is to update the enquiry status.

Subsequently, a quote is created based on the analysis, and the quote goes for customer approval. If the customer approval is not received, the enquiry status is updated, and the process ends with the notification of non-approval.

Upon receiving customer approval, a job is created, and the process finalizes successfully with the job being created and confirming that the quote was successfully accepted. 

Throughout the process, messages flow between Accentis and the customer, starting with the sales enquiry request received from the customer, the customer approval sent back to Accentis, and finally capturing the customer approval received to continue the process stages towards creating the job.

1.text:
The process begins with the customer sending a sales enquiry request to Accentis. Upon receiving the sales enquiry request, Accentis initiates the creation of an enquiry. 

Next, the process checks if the customer is an inbound or outbound customer. If the customer is inbound, a contact is created. However, if the customer is outbound, the process proceeds directly to the first decision point.

The first decision point distinguishes between the two customer types to ensure the correct path is followed. From here, the process evaluates whether the quoted price is acceptable and if the customer has shown interest. If the price is approved, the customer sends their approval back to Accentis. This approval is captured, leading to branching to the next decision point: confirming if the price is approved by the customer.

If the price is approved, requirements analysis for qualification involves conducting thorough requirements analysis. After the analysis, the system creates a quote and subsequently updates the enquiry status.

Following this, the process undertakes a review of the enquiry status. If the customer does not approve the quote, the process terminates with a non-approval end event. On the contrary, if the customer approves, a job is created, updating the enquiry status to indicate progression, and the process ends with the job being successfully created.

Throughout this process, communications between the customer and Accentis flow appropriately. The customer sends approval messages, and certain internal tasks update the enquiry status after key activities, ensuring a streamlined and transparent process flow. The final marking point of the process is the creation of the job, signifying the successful completion of the task sequence.

tasks.name: Evaluate quoted price and customer interest

2.text:
The process begins when a sales enquiry is created by the customer. If the customer is an inbound customer, a contact is created, otherwise, an enquiry is created. Both scenarios converge at a decision point.

From here, a qualified evaluation is done to check the price and interest, and the customer's approval is requested. If the price is not approved, the enquiry status is updated, and the process ends with the client not approving.

If the price is approved, a quote is created, followed by a requirements analysis qualification. 

After this, the enquiry status is updated.

Once the enquiry status is updated, a job is created, marking the end of the process with the job created.

The process also includes the possibility of directly updating the enquiry status during the qualified price and interest check, leading to the final approval event.

There are no message flows between 'Accentis' and the 'Customer'. The communication mainly revolves around sales enquiries and customer approvals through internal updates and pricing qualifications. 

The end points vary based on the outcomes at the decision points: approval leading to job creation or non-approval resulting in the client not approving.

The process begins when the ACME AG receives a job application.

Upon receipt of the application, the Human Resources Department sends a receipt confirmation to the applicant.

Afterward, the suitability of the applicant is verified. If the applicant is deemed suitable, an invitation to a job interview is sent to the applicant.

Subsequently, preparations for the employment agreement are made. Following these preparations, a job interview is carried out.

After the interview, the applicant’s suitability is assessed once again. If the applicant is suitable, an employment contract is sent to the applicant.

If the applicant is not suitable, a rejection is sent to the applicant, and the process confirms the rejection was sent, concluding this sequence.

If the applicant accepts the application status, they will proceed to sign the employment contract and send it back to the company.

After receipt of the signed employment contract, the process concludes with the confirmation that the signed employment contract is present within the Human Resources Department.

Throughout the process, various message flows facilitate communication between the ACME AG's Human Resources Department and the applicant, ensuring receipt confirmations, interview invitations, rejection notices, and employment contracts are appropriately sent and received.

The process starts when a booking request is received by the taxi booking system.

The customer service operator first checks the data provided in the booking request. If the necessary data is not sent, a cancellation message is sent and the process ends.

If the data is complete, the customer service operator checks for available cars. If there are any available cars within the next 30 minutes, the system proceeds to display a list of options for the nearest available car.

The customer service operator then picks the nearest car with the client and calculates the time of arrival.

After calculating the time of arrival, the taxi is booked and a booking confirmation message is sent to the customer, marking the end of the process.

If there are no cars available within the next 30 minutes, a cancellation message is sent to the customer, ending the process.

The process begins with the receipt of a loan application at DLL.

Initially, the application is handled by the risk manager who starts by performing a BKR check, a Jane Doe check, and a credibility check.

After the BKR and Jane Doe checks, the process follows two parallel paths. If the BKR and the Jane Doe assessments are accepted, the parallel flows converge, and the credibility check is then confirmed.

The result of the credibility check leads to one of two outcomes. If the credibility assessment is accepted, the senior risk manager activates the loan application. If the credibility assessment is rejected, a rejection letter is sent to the applicant.

When a rejection letter is sent, it goes through the administrator, and once the rejection letter is sent, the process ends.

If the loan application is activated, the application moves to finance, where it is validated, followed by the execution of the initial payment. After the initial payment is executed, the documents are returned to the client and the process ends.

Meanwhile, for the loan offer creation and correspondence, the customer relation team first creates a loan offer. The loan offer is then sent to the client. If no response is received within an hour, a reminder is sent.

Following the reminder, if the client does not accept the offer within another hour, another reminder is sent. Once the client accepts the offer, a welcome letter is dispatched and the process continues.

Upon sending the welcome letter, the loan offer is verified. If the offer is approved, it moves into the finance lane for loan application activation and subsequent payment validation and execution. Once the final step of returning the documents to the client is completed, the process concludes.

Each step involves distinct pathways and checks ensuring the client receives clear information and compliance checks are conducted accurately.

1.text:
The process starts at loan application reception at the DLL. 

The loan application is initially activated by the finance department. 

Subsequently, a validation of the loan activation is conducted. If the validation is successful, an initial payment is executed. Upon completion of this task, the documents are then returned to the client, and the process ends with the documents being successfully returned.

If further assessment is required, the Senior Risk Manager is involved in a credibility check, after which the results are confirmed. The confirmed results are then assessed to decide whether they are accepted or rejected. 

If the credibility assessment is accepted, a loan offer is created and sent to the customer by the customer relations team. If the loan offer is accepted, a welcome letter is sent, and the process continues to loan activation and validation as previously mentioned.

If the credibility assessment is rejected, a rejection letter is sent, and the process ends with the rejection letter being sent.

In the course of the risk management checks, additional checks like the BKR check (Dutch credit registration) and the Jane Doe check are performed. Each of these assessments has to be accepted for the process to continue.

During the process, if more information is needed from the client, the customer relations team might call the client for complementary information or send reminders. If the client picks up the reminders, the process will continue to the respective checks and assessments. If not, another reminder might be sent, or the further steps of the process might be contingent on the outcome of these reminders.

If after one hour the required information is not received, additional steps ensuring proper follow-up and client communication are taken until the process is either successfully completed or terminated due to non-compliance or other reasons. 

Critical points where the loan offer is checked and the client’s response is awaited, either through acceptance of the offer or request for additional information, ensure continuous client engagement and rigorous verification at each stage. These elements guarantee a methodical approach to loan processing and customer relations.

If at any decision point or check the process results in a rejection, the process is directed towards sending a rejection letter and returning the documents to the client.

Each of these steps, assessments, decisions, and client communications details the flow of the loan application process from start to end.

tasks.name: Credibility check by Senior Risk Manager

2.text:
The process starts when a loan application is activated by the finance department at DLL.

First, the risk manager performs a BKR check, a Jane Doe check, and a credibility check. If any of these checks are accepted, the parallel tasks to confirm the credibility check are performed and, subsequently, the senior risk manager confirms the credibility check. If the credibility check is acceptable, the process flows to an exclusive gateway.

If the credibility assessment is accepted, a loan offer is created by customer relations and sent to the client. An event-based gateway waits for the client's response within an hour. If the client accepts the loan offer, a welcome letter is sent by the administrator and the flow continues with validating the loan activation by finance. If the offer remains unaccepted after an hour, the client is reminded and the process cycles back to the check loan offer stage.

In the case that the credibility assessment is rejected, a rejection letter is sent by the administrator, leading to another exclusive gateway. When the rejection letter is sent, it triggers the end of this branch of the process.

If the client accepts the loan offer, the loan is activated by finance, followed by the validation of the loan activation, and the execution of the initial payment, concluding with the returning of documents to the client and the process ends.

tasks.name: Senior risk manager confirms credibility check

The process starts when an application arrives at the HR team of the Savings bank.

Upon receipt of the application, a receipt confirmation is sent to the applicant.

The HR team then reviews the application.

If the application is in order, it is evaluated by the IT department.

If the evaluation is positive, approval is sought from the Board of Directors.

If the approval is obtained, the HR team prepares the contract.

Once the contract is prepared, the applicant is confirmed, leading to the occupation of the position in the system.

After occupying the position in the system, the application process is completed, and the process ends with the applicant being hired.

If the application is not in order or is rejected at any point, the applicant is immediately notified of the rejection via a communication back to the applicant.

If the applicant is not suitable, the process will revisit stages to archive application documents, and finally, the process ends with the applicant being rejected.

In the case of delivery problems or the applicant declining the offer, notifications are sent back to the HR team and the process revisits to archive application documents. This results in the application process ending at this stage without hiring.

Throughout the process, different subprocesses such as inviting the applicant, preparing for interview, conducting the interview, selecting an applicant, contract signing, and placing the applicant in position are executed as part of the hiring process.

tasks.name: Seek approval from Board of Directors
Notify HR team of delivery problems or applicant declining offer

events.name: Delivery problems or applicant declines offer

1.text:
The process starts when the application arrives at the savings bank. Upon arrival, a receipt confirmation is sent to the applicant. The application is then reviewed.

If the application is in order, it is evaluated by the IT department. If the applicant is found suitable during this evaluation, the process moves to confirm the applicant.

If the applicant is not suitable, a rejection message is sent.

Assuming the applicant is suitable, they are put on a list and an invitation is prepared and sent. The process then proceeds with the preparation of the interview followed by conducting the interview.

After the interview is conducted, it is determined if the applicant is good. If the applicant is good, they are selected, and the process moves to obtain approval from the Board of Directors.

If the hiring is not approved, the application is archived.

If hiring is approved, a contract is prepared and subsequently signed by undergoing a contract signing process. Once the contract is signed, the position is occupied in the system.

The completion of the application process takes place leading to either the applicant being placed in the position or the applicant being hired, marking the end of the process.

In case the application is not in order, it is rejected, leading to the applicant being rejected.

If the applicant declines at any stage or the hiring is not approved due to an error, corresponding error events handle these exceptions, ensuring the process gracefully ends with proper communication.

tasks.name: Obtain approval from Board of Directors

2.text:
The process starts when an application arrives at the HR team of the savings bank. Upon receipt of the application, the HR team sends a receipt confirmation to the applicant.

Next, the HR team reviews the application to determine if it is in order. If the application is in order, it moves to evaluation, otherwise, the applicant is rejected and a rejection message is sent.

The HR team evaluates the application for suitability. If the applicant is suitable, the process proceeds to invite the applicant for an interview.

The HR team prepares for the interview and then conducts it. After the interview, they determine if the applicant is good. If the applicant is good, they are put on the list and the selection process commences.

Following this, the HR team prepares the contract for the selected applicant and occupies the position in the system. With the position now occupied, they complete the application process which results in the applicant being hired.

In case the HR team does not find the applicant suitable during the evaluation, they reject the applicant and a rejection message is sent. Additionally, the HR team prepares for a new targeting movement.

At the end of the process, the HR team archives the application documents. If the applicant accepts the position, they move to the contract signing and then place the applicant in the position. Finally, the process ends with the status of "Applicant Hired."

However, if there are issues such as the applicant declining the offer or hiring not being approved, the process ends with the respective intermediary events triggering necessary adjustments before finally concluding.

The process begins when an order is received, initiating the requirement description.

Following this, a workshop is conducted, leading to the creation of a project sketch.

An appointment is then set, succeeded by a customer conversation.

The next step is writing a specification sheet.

Information is then sent to the customer.

After this, project and capacity planning is performed.

Standard open-source products are checked,

leading to the definition of use cases.

Costs are then calculated.

At this point, a decision is made on whether to pursue new development or use existing products.

If existing products are chosen, knowledge management systems are adjusted as part of the target process.

This adjustment is followed by identifying follow-up projects.

Customer feedback is obtained, confirming the execution.

If new products are chosen, product development is carried out as part of the target process.

A subsequent decision determines if product acceptance is needed.

If so, the product acceptance is performed, followed by customer feedback and the identification of follow-up projects.

The process concludes with the order completion. Message flows indicate that the customer confirms appointments, receives product information, sends feedback for both product acceptance, and feedback for knowledge management system adjustments.

gateways.name: Decision: New Development or Existing Products

1.text:
The process kicks off with the intake of an order. This triggers the description of requirements, followed by conducting a workshop to gather insights and create a project sketch. After setting an appointment, a customer conversation is conducted to gather further information, which is then used to write a specification sheet. The next step involves sending this information back to the customer, who confirms the appointment. 

The development team begins by performing project and capacity planning, but first checks for existing standard open-source products. If such products are viable, they define the use cases and subsequently, calculate costs associated with utilizing these products. This cost calculation leads to a decision whether a new product needs to be developed or if existing products can be utilized. 

If existing products are chosen, an adjustment of the knowledge management systems is carried out. From there, the process moves to identifying follow-up projects and obtaining customer feedback. If new products are chosen, the product needs to be developed, which is followed by performing product acceptance with customer participation, receiving feedback, and feeding the product back into the knowledge management systems.

Finally, the process concludes by sending the necessary information forward to the customer and marking the order as completed. Throughout the process, various communications with the customer take place via message events, ensuring important updates and feedback loops are well-managed.

tasks.name: Check for existing standard open-source products
Feed product into knowledge management systems

2.text:
The process starts with the development department at SoKnow when an order is received. The requirements for the order are then described. Following this, a workshop is conducted to gather information and insights. Based on the outcomes of the workshop, a project sketch is created. 

An appointment is set, and after the confirmation of this appointment, a customer conversation is conducted to align and refine the project details. The results of this conversation are documented in a specification sheet. 

During the creation of the specification sheet, information is sent to the customer company. Once the specification sheet is finalized, the customer acknowledges the receipt of the information, providing feedback. The feedback is then received and processed, leading to a project and capacity planning step. 

Based on the planning, the development department checks standard open-source products to identify potential solutions. If relevant products are found, they define use cases for integration. If new development is required, costs are calculated.

At this point, a decision gateway assesses whether to proceed with existing products or to develop new products. If existing products are chosen, the process moves to the adjustment of knowledge management systems. Post-adjustment, another decision is made on identifying follow-up projects and obtaining further feedback, culminating in the identification of next steps.

If new products are determined to be necessary, the development department begins the development process. Subsequently, another decision gateway evaluates the readiness for product acceptance. This is followed by scheduling and inviting customers to participate in product acceptance. Upon completing the acceptance phase, the customer's feedback is obtained.

Finally, based on customer feedback, the process ends by identifying follow-up projects and possibly completing the order if no further actions are required. The entire process wraps up when the order is deemed completed.

tasks.name: Identify follow-up projects and obtain feedback
Schedule and invite customers for product acceptance

gateways.name: Proceed with existing products or develop new products?

The process begins when hunger arises.

First, a pizza is chosen from the menu.

Then, the pizza is ordered by phone.

Following the order, there is a decision point where the process waits for either the pizza to arrive or 60 minutes to pass.

If 60 minutes pass without the pizza arriving, the customer calls the pizzeria to inquire about the status of the order.

Once the pizza has arrived, the next step is to pay the delivery boy for the pizza.

After payment, the customer eats the pizza.

The process concludes when the hunger is satisfied.

tasks.name: Call pizzeria to inquire about order status

1.text:
The process begins when the customer feels hunger.

The customer first chooses a pizza from the menu.

After selecting the pizza, the customer orders the pizza by phone.

Once the order is placed, there are two possibilities. Either 60 minutes pass without the pizza arriving, or the customer gets notified that the pizza has arrived.

If 60 minutes pass and the pizza has not arrived, the customer calls the pizzeria to inquire about the order.

Once the customer inquires, if the pizza still arrives, they will be notified immediately.

If the pizza arrives on time or after the inquiry, the customer then pays the delivery boy for the pizza.

After payment, the customer eats the pizza.

Finally, the process ends once the customer's hunger is satisfied.

tasks.name: Call pizzeria to inquire about order

2.text:
The process begins when the Customer feels hunger.

First, the Customer chooses a pizza from the menu.

After selecting the pizza, the Customer places an order by phone.

An event-based decision point then occurs. If the pizza arrives within 60 minutes, the process continues. If not, an alternative path is taken.

If 60 minutes pass without the pizza arriving, the Customer calls the pizzeria to inquire about the order status. Once the pizza arrives, a message is received, and the Customer proceeds to the next step.

When the pizza arrives, whether directly or after the inquiry, a decision is made regarding the payment.

Upon arrival, the Customer pays the delivery boy for the pizza.

Finally, the Customer eats the pizza.

Once the pizza is eaten, the hunger is satisfied, and the process concludes.

tasks.name: Call pizzeria to inquire about order status

The process begins when the HR personnel, specifically a clerk, starts the task by retrieving the requirement profile.

After obtaining the requirement profile, the clerk retrieves the job posting.

Following this, the clerk checks if comments need to be added to the note. If comments are necessary, the clerk creates a co-signature note.

Once the co-signature note is prepared, the clerk forwards it along to the section manager for review. The section manager checks the note to determine if comments are required.

If comments are required, the note undergoes further review and is forwarded to the department head. The department head then decides whether there are comments to be added to the note.

If no comments are needed, the note is forwarded back to the section manager for another check. If the section manager still finds no further comments, the process proceeds to the end.

If the department head decides that comments are not necessary, the process also proceeds to the end.

Consequently, the department head checks whether any additional comments are required, and if none are needed, the process ends with the note approved without further amendments.

If at any point, any of the managers decide to add comments, new reviews are conducted until no more comments are found to be necessary, terminating the process once all checks have been completed and the note is approved fully.

tasks.name: Check if comments need to be added

1.text:
The process starts when the clerk retrieves a requirement profile. Next, the clerk retrieves a job posting. Afterward, there is an evaluation to decide whether further comments are needed.

If comments are required, a co-signature note is created and forwarded. The co-signature note is then checked by the section manager, leading to another evaluation about whether additional comments are needed.

If additional comments are not required at this step, the section manager forwards the note to the department head, who subsequently checks it. Another evaluation is performed to determine if more comments are necessary. If no more comments are needed at this stage, the process ends.

However, if it is determined additional comments are once again necessary, the process returns to the initial decision point about whether comments are required. If at any point, comments are not needed, the process will finally conclude.

2.text:
The process starts when the Clerk in HR Personnel retrieves the requirement profile.

If there are no comments, the Clerk creates a co-signature note.

If there are comments, the Clerk forwards the co-signature note.

The Section Manager then checks the note. 

Based on the results, a decision is made. 

If there are comments, the note is forwarded back to the Clerk. 

If there are no comments, the note is sent to the Department Head for checking.

Another exclusive decision is made by the Department Head. 

If there are no comments, the process reaches the End.

If there are comments, the note may be forwarded back to the respective previous steps for further review until it is finalized.

The process concludes once there are no further comments and the note has been successfully processed through all required checks.
