The process begins when a need arises in the procurement department of ACME AG.

First, the stock is checked to see if the work equipment required is available.

If the work equipment is in stock, it is retrieved from the storeroom, and the process ends with the equipment being removed from the storeroom.

If the work equipment is not in stock, the requirements are specified and quantified. Subsequently, an order is placed.

Once the order is placed, an event-based decision determines the next step. A timer event waits for five days, and if no receipt of the work equipment is confirmed within this timeframe, an email order is placed to the supplier.

Upon placing the order by email, the supplier, upon receiving the order, confirms the receipt of the order equipment back to ACME AG.

After receiving the confirmation, the equipment is checked again, and once the work equipment is procured, the process ends.

1.text:
The process begins when a need arises at the ACME AG Procurement department.

Initially, the stock is checked to see if the required work equipment is available.

If the work equipment is in stock, it is retrieved from the storeroom, and the process ends with the work equipment being successfully removed from the storeroom.

If the work equipment is not in stock, the requirements are specified and quantified, and an order is placed for the equipment.

Following this, an event-based decision is made.

If the order is placed by email, a timer triggers a wait of five days before placing the order by email to the supplier.

Upon sending the order, the supplier sends a message confirming the receipt of the work equipment, followed by another message upon actual receipt of the work equipment.

Once the receipt of work equipment is confirmed by the supplier, an exclusive decision waits until the receipt of the work equipment is confirmed, and then the process ends with the work equipment being procured.

tasks.name: Wait for 5 days before placing order by email
Send order by email to supplier

events.name: Supplier confirms receipt of work equipment
Supplier confirms actual receipt of work equipment

2.text:
The process begins when a need arises at the ACME AG.

The first step is to check if the required work equipment is in stock.

If the work equipment is in stock, it is retrieved from the storeroom, and the process ends with the work equipment being removed from the storeroom.

If the work equipment is not in stock, the requirements are specified and quantified.

Next, an order is placed.

Following this, an event-based gateway is triggered with two possible paths. First, a timer event waits for 5 days before an order is placed by e-mail. The second path goes directly towards receiving a message from the supplier indicating the receipt of work equipment. 

After sending the order via e-mail, two events may occur: either the work equipment is received, or a message catching event indicating receipt of work equipment by the supplier triggers the process. If the intermediate message event "Receipt of work equipment" is caught, the stock availability is confirmed and the process moves forward, completing its path.

Finally, the process reaches an exclusive gateway where it diverges into two branches: if the work equipment is received either from the timer path or directly from the supplier, it proceeds to check if all the products have been delivered satisfactorily. The process ends with the procurement of work equipment.

tasks.name: Check if work equipment is in stock
Check if all products delivered satisfactorily

The process begins with a new service being initiated, following which the client enters the store. 

The client will then look for a specific service. Next, the client determines where the ticket will be taken. If taken via an app, the client proceeds to choose the service. After choosing the service, the client waits for a specific waiting time before looking for the product and specific criteria. 

If the ticket is taken physically, the client takes the ticket representing his/her turn before choosing the service. Subsequently, the client waits for his/her turn, checks how many tickets are ahead, then proceeds to look for a specific service.

Depending on whether the client is asking for a specific request, the client looks for the product and specific criteria.

At this point, the process diverges based on whether the client requests a specific service. If the client does not make any new requests, the process ends. If the client makes a new request, the client checks how many tickets are ahead and waits for his/her turn again.

Once the client collects his/her order, the shop assistants' team prepares the order. The preparation is marked by the reception of an order description. After the preparation is completed, the order is delivered to the client.

There is also a parallel process for the request assistant. The Register Request task is initiated on the registration time. After enough requests have been registered to respond to customer demand, an order request document is sent. Upon completion of this task, the registration process is over. If there are not enough requests to respond to customer demand, the registration process returns to the beginning.

Throughout the process, if there are no new requests, the client proceeds to the end of the process. However, if there are new requests, the process sequence flows are maintained for efficiency and continuity.

tasks.name: Look for product and specific criteria
Look for product and specific criteria

1.text:
The process begins at the register time. It starts with registering the request and an evaluation of whether there are enough requests to meet customer demand. If there are enough requests, the order request document is sent, concluding with the registration over. If there are not enough requests, the process loops back to registering the request.

Meanwhile, a new service starts with the client choosing the service. The client then proceeds to enter the store and looks for a specific service. If the service allows for it, the client checks how many tickets are ahead and waits for their turn. If they take a ticket representing their turn, they then wait until their turn comes. If there are waiting times, the client is asked if they have a new request. If they have a new request, they start from choosing the new service again; if not, the client exits the process.

When the client’s turn comes, they collect their order. For specific requests, they are asked by the request assistant for details. The order is prepared by the shop assistant team, and once preparation is finished, the order is delivered to the client, concluding the process.

Throughout the process, message flows are observed where the client’s specific request is sent to register the request, and the shop assistant team is notified to prepare the order after receiving the order request document. The preparation completion is communicated back to the store, after which the client collects their order and exits.

2.text:
The process starts when a new service request is initiated.

The client enters the store and chooses the service they need.

The client then takes a ticket representing their turn, and waits for their turn.

The client checks how many tickets are ahead of them, and continues to wait for their turn.

When it is finally their turn, the client describes their specific request to the request assistant.

The request assistant registers the request, and verifies if there are enough requests to respond to customer demand.

If there are not enough requests, the assistant will re-register the request until there are enough requests. 

Once there are enough requests, the assistant sends the order request document to the shop assistants' team, including the order description.

The shop assistants prepare the order.

The order is then delivered, and the client collects their order.

If the client contacts the assistant and there is a new request, the assistant will start the process from the beginning.

In the case of any waiting time during the process, the client continues to wait.

Once the preparation is finished, the assistant marks the registration as over.

Finally, the process ends.

tasks.name: Send order request to shop assistants

The process starts with a request from the customer at The Bike Zone. The request is then sent and accepted and processed by GBI.

Subsequently, an offer is processed for the customer. Once the offer is prepared, it is copied to an order and sent to the customer.

Following this, the order is accepted and processed. The inventory is then checked to determine if the product is in stock.

If the product is available, the materials are picked, packed, loaded, and sent to the customer. Delivery notes are created and associated documents are edited and displayed.

If additional materials need to be procured, an order is placed and goods are ordered.

The goods are received, and an invoice is created and sent to the customer.

Once the customer receives the invoice, their payment is processed and settled, completing the order process. 

The entire workflow ensures that customer orders are processed and fulfilled efficiently, tracking each stage from the initial request to the final payment processing.

tasks.name: Copy offer to order and send to customer
Pick, pack, load, and send materials
Create delivery notes and edit/display documents

1.text:
The process begins when a request is started in the system by The Bike Zone.

A request is then sent to GBI, where upon receipt, GBI accepts and processes the request. The customer master data is created initially if it's the first interaction with the customer.

If the master data already exists, it is eventually changed as per the new request. Following this, the request is processed, and an offer is generated.

Once completed, the offer is copied over to form an order, which is then sent to the customer for approval.

If the product required is already in stock, it initiates an inventory check. If the product is available, a delivery note is created, and the goods are then picked.

The material is packed and loaded, followed by sending it to the customer. There is a corresponding goods receipt process at The Bike Zone, indicating that the goods have been received.

If the product is not in stock, meaning that procurement is necessary, it triggers the task for ordering goods via the material management (MM).

Once the goods are received, an invoice is created within the finance (FI) department of GBI and sent to The Bike Zone.

The Bike Zone then processes the receipt of the goods and the invoice simultaneously. Upon receipt of the invoice, The Bike Zone accepts it and processes payment.

The finance (FI) department at GBI completes the process by settling the invoice and processing the incoming payment from The Bike Zone. Finally, document flow is edited and displayed to ensure all processes are correctly logged. The process concludes successfully with the order being marked as finished.

tasks.name: Send order to customer for approval
Goods receipt at The Bike Zone
Process receipt of goods and invoice
Settle invoice and process incoming payment

2.text:
The process begins with the initiation of a request from a customer at The Bike Zone and involves sending a request to GBI Sales (SD). GBI initiates by creating customer master data, or changes customer data if necessary, and then accepts and processes the request.

After the request is processed, the offer is created and sent to the customer. Upon receiving the offer, the customer sends back an acceptance, prompting GBI to process the customer's order.

Next, GBI checks inventory for the availability of products. If the product is available in stock, it is requested from the inventory. If not, the necessary goods are procured or ordered.

After the goods are procured, the inventory control picks the materials, packs/loads them, and sends them to the customer. Upon receipt of the goods by the customer, an invoice is created and sent to the customer.

Simultaneously, the customer receives the invoice, and processes it. Finally, the customer makes a payment, which GBI processes and registers, completing the transaction.

As the payment is confirmed, the delivery note is created, and the entire document flow is edited and displayed, signaling the completion of the customer order process. The process concludes with the order being marked as finished.

Throughout the process, communication occurs between different elements through message flows. The messages exchanged include order confirmation, invoices, and payment confirmations, ensuring all stakeholders are kept informed about the status of the tasks.

tasks.name: Create or Change Customer Master Data

The process starts with the preparation of the workplace by setting up an anti-static mat, tools, and gloves. The motherboard is then placed on the anti-static mat. Next, thermal paste is applied.

If the installation is not possible, steps are retried as per the issue identified. If it is possible to install, the CPU is placed into the processor.

After installing the CPU, several checks are performed to ensure proper installation:

1. If there is no image on the screen, related troubleshooting steps are undertaken.
2. If the hard drive is not recognized, the issue is addressed.
3. If there is no power, appropriate measures are taken.
4. If a boot loop occurs, the problem is resolved.

If all checks pass successfully, the installation is deemed possible again, and further verifications are conducted:

1. The system is tested for power issues again.
2. Any lingering power issues are addressed.
3. The installation is retried until success.

Once these verifications are confirmed without issues, the process proceeds to ensure that everything functions correctly, and finally, the successful setup is validated, leading to the conclusion of the process with the system end.

tasks.name: Retry steps as per issue identified

1.text:
The process begins with the assembly of a PC. First, the workplace is prepared with an anti-static mat, tools, and gloves. After the workplace is ready, the motherboard is placed on the anti-static mat.

Next, the CPU is placed into the processor slot on the motherboard.

Then, thermal paste is applied, and it is checked whether the installation is possible.

If the installation is not possible, the process ends. If the installation is possible, various conditions are checked:

- If there is no image, the process moves forward.
- If the hard drive is not recognized, the process advances similarly.
- If there is no power, it moves forward again.
- If the system is in a boot loop, the process progresses further.

These conditions are then directed through an inclusive gateway. The inclusive gateway transitions to the task based on the current condition such as no image, unrecognized hard drive, no power, or a boot loop.

Following this, another inclusive gateway decision is made whether the installation is possible. If it is still not possible, the process ends. If the installation is successful, the process continues to the next manual task.

This manual task involves checking and addressing the parts or system accordingly. After that, the process reaches an end event, and the PC assembly process is completed.

tasks.name: Check and address parts or system

2.text:
The process begins with preparing the workplace with an anti-static mat, tools, and gloves.

Next, the motherboard is placed on the anti-static mat.

The CPU is then placed into the processor.

Following this, thermal paste is applied, and possible issues with installation are checked.

If the installation is possible, the process will continue; otherwise, the process diverges based on several conditions:

If there is an image problem, hard drive not recognized, and no power issues, then these issues are handled in the order given.

Further, during these checks, if there is a boot loop, it is examined and resolved.

Within these processes, each resolved issue returns to check if installation is possible or if there are further issues.

Once all uploads are checked and addressed, the installation is checked again to be concluded successfully.

If any issues persist, they are revisited, making sure the installation problem is rectified or noted otherwise.

With successful installation confirmed, it leads to the final step where the installation is checked once more ensuring no issues persist and if all is well, the process concludes successfully.

tasks.name: Prepare workplace with anti-static mat, tools, and gloves

The process begins when an application is received, which prompts the HR department at ACME AG to send an acknowledgment of receipt to the applicant.

The HR department then invites the applicant to a job interview.

If the decision is to invite, the HR department proceeds to prepare for the employment contract.

Once the employment contract is prepared, the interview is conducted.

After conducting the interview, a decision is made on whether the applicant is suitable.

If the applicant is deemed suitable, the employment contract is sent to the applicant.

Upon receiving a signed employment contract back from the applicant, the HR department handles receipt of the signed contract.

The process then concludes with the signed employment contract being available.

If the applicant is not suitable, a rejection message is sent by the HR department, ending the process with the applicant being rejected.

Alternatively, if the application status after the first review results in a rejection, the rejection is sent to the applicant and this branch of the process also concludes with the HR department finalizing the rejection.

1.text:
The process begins when an application is received by the HR department of ACME AG from the applicant. A message acknowledging the receipt is then sent back to the applicant.

The HR department proceeds by checking the applicant's suitability. If the applicant is deemed suitable, an invitation to a job interview is sent to them. Meanwhile, the HR department prepares the employment contract.

The invited applicant will then participate in the job interview conducted by the HR department. Post-interview, the application status is assessed. If the application continues in the process, another verification is performed to decide if the applicant should be invited or rejected.

If the applicant is to be rejected, a rejection is sent to the applicant, and the process concludes with the applicant being rejected.

If the applicant is to be invited, an employment contract is sent to the applicant. The process then waits for the signed employment contract to be received back from the applicant.

Once the signed employment contract is received, the HR department finalizes the preparation and the process ends with the signed employment contract being available.

If the contract is not signed and the decision is to reject, the rejection is confirmed and the process ends with the applicant being rejected.

2.text:
The process begins when ACME AG's HR department receives a job application.

Firstly, an acknowledgment of receipt is sent back to the applicant.

Next, the HR manager checks the applicant’s qualifications and suitability.

Depending on the application status, one of two paths is followed. If the applicant is to be rejected, a rejection message is sent.

If the applicant is to be invited, an invitation for a job interview is sent.

Upon inviting the applicant, the HR department prepares for the interview by preparing the necessary documents.

The interview is then conducted.

After the interview, the suitability of the applicant is assessed.

If the applicant is found not suitable, a rejection message is sent, and the process ends with the applicant being rejected.

If the applicant is suitable, an employment contract is prepared by HR department.

The prepared employment contract is then sent to the applicant.

Once the signed employment contract is received back from the applicant, the HR department ends the process with the acknowledgment that the signed employment contract is available.

The process starts when a hotel guest's order is received by the room service manager at Hotel Evanstonian. The room service manager then creates and forwards an order ticket.

This initiates parallel actions. Firstly, the kitchen begins to prepare the meals. Simultaneously, the waiter prepares the car and non-alcoholic beverages.

Meanwhile, a decision is made regarding the wine. If wine is desired, the sommelier fetches wine from the cellar. If not, the process skips to checking if other alcoholic beverages are desired.

For other alcoholic beverages, if they are desired, the sommelier prepares the alcoholic beverages. If not, this step is skipped.

Both the non-alcoholic beverages and any prepared alcoholic beverages are then sent to the waiter.

The waiter then combines the prepared meals, non-alcoholic beverages, and any alcoholic beverages to deliver the desired order.

Upon successful delivery, there's a check for other conditions; if there are no other orders to process, the customer's account is debited.

Finally, the process concludes with the end event marking the completion of the customer order. Communication always takes place between the hotel guest for the order received and the final delivery of the desired order.

The process starts when a hotel guest places an order.

The room service manager then creates and forwards the order ticket.

Next, the process splits into several parallel activities. In the kitchen, the meals are prepared.

Meanwhile, the sommelier checks if wine is desired. If wine is desired, the sommelier fetches wine from the cellar. The sommelier also checks if other alcoholic beverages are desired. If any other alcoholic beverages are desired, they are prepared. If no alcoholic beverages are needed, the sommelier moves to the next step.

At the same time, the waiter prepares the car to deliver the order and prepares non-alcoholic beverages if needed.

Once all parallel tasks are completed, the desired order is delivered to the guest.

If there are no other orders to process, the waiter's account is debited and the customer's account is credited. The process ends with the completion of the customer order.

2.text:
The process begins when a hotel guest sends a message indicating that an order has been received.

The room service manager then creates and forwards the order ticket. A parallel gateway ensures that the kitchen begins to prepare meals while the room service manager starts other related tasks. 

Simultaneously, the sommelier checks if wine is desired. If wine is desired, the sommelier fetches wine from the cellar. If wine is not desired, the sommelier checks if other alcoholic beverages are desired. 

If other alcoholic beverages are desired, the sommelier prepares these drinks and proceeds to check if there are no other orders to process. If no other alcoholic beverages are desired, the sommelier also proceeds to check if there are no other orders to process.

Back in the kitchen, non-alcoholic beverages are prepared. Subsequently, the waiter prepares the car for delivery.

After the preparation tasks are completed, a parallel gateway ensures that all the prepared items (meals, beverages, and any special requests) are delivered as the desired order.

Once the customer receives the desired order, the waiter informs the hotel guest of the completed customer order and prepares to debit the customer's account.

If there are no other orders to process, the waiter's task is complete, and the customer's order is marked as finished. If there are additional orders to be processed, the waiter proceeds accordingly.

Throughout the process, any delivered orders are communicated back to the hotel guest to notify them of the successful delivery.

The process begins when the travel details are fixed for the road trip participant.

The first task is to prepare a checklist for the preparations.

After the checklist is prepared, necessary papers are checked and completed.

If a visa is required, an application for the visa is sent to the embassy. Then any unfinished business is cleared. If no visa is required, the unfinished business is cleared directly.

Following this, it is determined if there are pets to take care of. If yes, arrangements are made for their care. If no, the participant proceeds to unsubscribe from post or request a neighbor to fetch it. 

Next, regardless of the pets condition, the participant unsubscribes from the mail or informs a neighbor to fetch it. Then, copies of ID cards and travel documents are made, and necessary vaccination is acquired. Once vaccinations are obtained, insurance coverage is checked and further coverage is applied for if necessary, with a communication to the insurance company.

A parallel gateway is then encountered where multiple tasks are done simultaneously: gathering travel documents and addresses, buying or lending guidebooks and city maps, and preparing a first-aid kit.

Finally, these concurrent tasks converge, and the travel preparations are complete, ending the process.

The process begins when travel details are fixed.

The first step is to prepare a checklist for preparations.

Next, necessary papers are checked and completed.

Then, a decision is made whether a visa is required. If a visa is required, an application for a visa is sent. Subsequently, any unfinished business is cleared.

If a visa is not required, the process proceeds to handle whether there are pets that need to be taken care of. If pets need care, arrangements are made for their care. If no pets need care, the process continues to the next step.

In parallel, travel documents and addresses are gathered, vaccination is acquired if necessary, insurance coverage is checked, guidebooks and city maps are bought or borrowed, a first-aid kit is prepared, and copies of ID cards and travel documents are made.

After travel documents and addresses are gathered, these steps converge.

Finally, the process ends when all travel preparations are completed.

During the process, notifications to the embassy regarding visa applications and communication with the insurance company about checking coverage may occur.

2.text:
The process begins when the travel details are fixed. The road trip participant prepares a check-list for preparations. Following this, they check and complete the necessary papers. If a visa is required, they apply for the visa, sending the necessary information to the embassy. Subsequently, all unfinished business is cleared.

In parallel, the participant gathers travel documents and addresses, checks insurance coverage and applies for additional coverage if necessary, buys or borrows guidebooks and city maps, and prepares a first-aid kit.

If the participant has pets to take care of, they arrange care for the pets. If not, they unsubscribe from post or request their neighbor to fetch it. They also make copies of ID cards and travel documents, get necessary vaccinations, and check insurance coverage again if required.

As part of the final preparations, the participant ensures everything is ready by handling any extra tasks like arranging care for pets or dealing with the insurance company. The process concludes once all travel preparations have been completed.
